content.description:
Sit start low matched on the fin and climb straight up through some slopers and crimps.

I assume this problem has been done many a time but don’t see it listed here or in the guidebook and I enjoyed the climb so I thought it’d be worth a share.  If you know the actual name for the problem let me know and I will update the info
content.location: Immediately prior to the huge broken block, that was previously called Broken.

content.description: Sit start (or just start low if you're short) with a large right hand undercling and a left hand around the arete.  Work your way up, then right, topping out at the notch.  Downclimb the back side for the descent.
content.location: After leaving the stage coach road to go to the Labyrinth, you pass two sink holes and go left to The Cave Route, turn right instead and go out into the open field.  In the back right of that field, you'll see a 30 ft boulder through the trees, just passed the edge of the trail.

content.description:
Begin on the large jug with opposing feet.  Traverse up and left.  Top out at the obvious horn.  Sort of epic...  With 3 hours of scrubbing, I assume I have the first ascent, but if you know otherwise, please let me know!  Route is still a little dirty, but it should be good to climb with some light brushing.  Great for a hot day, as area is shaded.

Follow the cat walk to the right for the descent.  Best to scope out before you top out.
content.location: The next large boulder to the right, after The Cave Route (V3)

content.description:
Really fun boulder with a couple of ways to do it all about the same difficulty.

Not sure of the name for this boulder either so just let me know and I’ll update it.
content.location: Past the large broken block through a narrow corridor, will be tucked away in a little cave directly in front of you after exiting the corridor.

content.description: Sit start on the low jug, climb up and out to the right.
content.location: This is the first problem on your right after getting onto the Labrynth approach trail.

content.description: Start low matched on the undercling and climb up trending right and topping out on jugs.  Avoid the crimp rail out to the left that is used on Birthday Scrubbing.
content.location: Along the approach trail into the labyrinth.  About 20 yards past the cave route in a pit off to the left.

content.description: Start the same as for Blob Wall and climb up and left using the crimp rail to a top out on slopers.
